scenario:
British American Tobacco (BTI) has shown resilience in a declining cigarette market by focusing on innovation and high-growth categories. The stock has returned 31% over the past year, driven by an improving growth outlook. Key reasons to consider buying BTI stock include:

- A robust and highly profitable business with a diversified global footprint, operating in over 150 countries and generating 18% of revenue from new categories in the first six months of 2024.
- A compelling valuation with a forward price-to-earnings ratio of 7 times 2025 consensus EPS, significantly below industry peers Altria Group and Philip Morris International.
- An attractive high-yield dividend of 8.2%, supported by significant free-cash-flow generation and a 25-year track record of dividend increases.

The company expects low-single-digit organic revenue and adjusted profit growth in constant currency terms for 2024, with management forecasting "progressive improvement" into 2025 and stronger profitable growth in the mid-single-digit range by 2026 and beyond.
